title: U.S. Judge Sides With Iraq, Blocks Kurds' Attempt To Sell Oil
teaser: A U.S. judge has blocked an effort by Iraq's Kurdistan region to sell $100 million worth of crude oil to refiners in the U.S. It's sitting in a giant tanker ship off the coast of Texas. The judge agreed with the Iraqi government that the oil belongs to it and not the Kurds.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
